Detailed Description

An IPv4 or IPv6 Internet address.

vrt::InetAddress::InetAddress ( const vector< char > &  addr,
size_t  off = 0 
)

Creates a new instance, using the specified address from a buffer.

If off is 0 and the vector size is 4, then a 4-byte IPv4 address is used, otherwise a 16-byte IPv6 address is assumed.

Parameters:
addr The given address.
off The offset into the array.
vrt::InetAddress::InetAddress ( const void *  addr,
size_t  off,
size_t  len 
)

Creates a new instance, using the specified address from a buffer.

If off is 0 and the vector size is 4, then a 4-byte IPv4 address is used, otherwise a 16-byte IPv6 address is assumed.

Parameters:
addr The given address.
off The offset into the array.
len The length of the address (4=IPv4, 16=IPv6).

Member Function Documentation

virtual bool vrt::InetAddress::equals ( const InetAddress &  addr  )  const [virtual]

Checks to see if two addresses are equal.

Note that for the purposes of this check "0.0.0.0" and "::0" are considered NOT EQUAL even though both are considered a "null value" (the difference being IPv4 null vs IPv6 null).

Reimplemented from vrt::VRTObject.

virtual bool vrt::InetAddress::equals ( const VRTObject &  o  )  const [virtual]

Checks to see if two addresses are equal.

Note that for the purposes of this check "0.0.0.0" and "::0" are considered NOT EQUAL even though both are considered a "null value" (the difference being IPv4 null vs IPv6 null).

virtual string vrt::InetAddress::getFieldName ( int32_t  id  )  const [virtual]

Gets the name of the given field.

In 90% of cases the field name will be identical to the name used in the applicable get/set function except without the get/set prefix (e.g. "SourceContext" for "getSourceContext"). It is possible to access the names of all fields via the following: 

    for (int32_t id = 0; id < getFieldCount(); id++) {
      // id is the field ID
      getFieldName(id);
    }

In situations where it is desirable to access all available fields, it is faster to use the field ID as this eliminates any string comparisons.

Parameters:
id The field ID (on range [0,getFieldCount())).
Returns:
The field name.
Exceptions:
VRTException if the field id is invalid.

Reimplemented from vrt::HasFields.

virtual ValueType vrt::InetAddress::getFieldType ( int32_t  id  )  const [virtual]

Gets the type associated with a given field.

Parameters:
id The field ID (on range [0,getFieldCount())).
Returns:
The field type (n > 0) or -N if the field is a vector of values where N is the component type of the vector.

static InetAddress vrt::InetAddress::getLocalHost (  )  [static]

Gets the local host address (not the loop-back address).

static InetAddress vrt::InetAddress::getLoopbackAddress (  )  [static]

Gets the loop-back address (this will be 127.0.0.1 or ::1).

The choice of IPv4 vs IPv6 is based on the VRT_PREFER_IPV6_ADDRESSES setting (see VRTConfig).
